Docs.param: A referencing the queue that includes the name of the account, the name of the queue, and a SAS token. This is likely to be similar to "https://{account_name}.queue.core.windows.net/{queue_name}?{sas_token}".

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual Azure.Response<Azure.Storage.Queues.Models.SendReceipt> SendMessage (string messageText);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Azure.Response`1<class Azure.Storage.Queues.Models.SendReceipt> SendMessage(string messageText) cil managed
Public Overridable Function SendMessage (messageText As String) As Response(Of SendReceipt)
abstract member SendMessage : string -> Azure.Response<Azure.Storage.Queues.Models.SendReceipt> override this.SendMessage : string -> Azure.Response<Azure.Storage.Queues.Models.SendReceipt>

Docs.param: Message text.
Docs.summary:
Adds a new message to the back of a queue.
A message must be in a format that can be included in an XML request with UTF-8 encoding. Otherwise option can be set to to handle non compliant messages. The encoded message can be up to 64 KiB in size for versions 2011-08-18 and newer, or 8 KiB in size for previous versions.
For more information, see
Put Message.
Docs.remarks: This version of library does not encode message by default. was the default behavior in the prior v11 library. See CloudQueue.EncodeMessage.

For more information, see
Set Queue Metadata.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual Azure.Response<Azure.Storage.Queues.Models.UpdateReceipt> UpdateMessage (string messageId, string popReceipt, BinaryData message, TimeSpan visibilityTimeout = default, System.Threading.CancellationToken cancellationToken = default);

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Azure.Response`1<class Azure.Storage.Queues.Models.UpdateReceipt> UpdateMessage(string messageId, string popReceipt, class System.BinaryData message, valuetype System.TimeSpan visibilityTimeout, valuetype System.Threading.CancellationToken cancellationToken) cil managed

Public Overridable Function UpdateMessage (messageId As String, popReceipt As String, message As BinaryData, Optional visibilityTimeout As TimeSpan = Nothing, Optional cancellationToken As CancellationToken = Nothing) As Response(Of UpdateReceipt)

abstract member UpdateMessage : string * string * BinaryData * TimeSpan * System.Threading.CancellationToken -> Azure.Response<Azure.Storage.Queues.Models.UpdateReceipt> override this.UpdateMessage : string * string * BinaryData * TimeSpan * System.Threading.CancellationToken -> Azure.Response<Azure.Storage.Queues.Models.UpdateReceipt>

Docs.param: ID of the message to update.
Required. Specifies the valid pop receipt value returned from an earlier call to the Get Messages or Update Message operation.
Optional. Updated message.

Required. Specifies the new visibility timeout value, in seconds, relative to server time. The new value must be larger than or equal to 0, and cannot be larger than 7 days. The visibility timeout of a message cannot be set to a value later than the expiry time. A message can be updated until it has been deleted or has expired.
Optional .
Docs.summary:
Changes a message's visibility timeout and contents.
A message must be in a format that can be included in an XML request with UTF-8 encoding. Otherwise option can be set to to handle non compliant messages. The encoded message can be up to 64 KiB in size for versions 2011-08-18 and newer, or 8 KiB in size for previous versions.
For more information, see
Update Message.
Docs.remarks: This version of library does not encode message by default. was the default behavior in the prior v11 library. See CloudQueue.EncodeMessage.
